head.supplied: 9/8/69 ¶ ¶ I am sorry to say, dear Mr Fitzgibbon, that the toll keeper, at the St Kilda road still has his fowl at large and that the birds have successively ruined a number of young trees. It is str...

div.p: Unit 733, VPRS 3181/P Town Clerk's file series 1, VA 511 Melbourne, Public Record Office, Victoria.
See also M to E. FitzGibbon, 13 July 1869. 9/8/69

I am sorry to say, dear Mr Fitzgibbon, that the toll keeper, at the St Kilda road still has his fowl at large and that the birds have successively ruined a number of young trees. It is strange, that such a person should dare to set all public authority at defiance.
The only way, allow me to remark, is this to deal with such people summarily, in including in the licence a clause, to keep no domestic animals at all on the spot.
